data.enText: slide/fall
to slide a short distance by accident so that you fall or nearly fall

data.chText: 她在冰上滑倒把腿摔断了。
data.enText: She slipped over on the ice and broke her leg.

data.chText: 我跑上楼梯时失脚摔倒了。
data.enText: As I ran up the stairs, my foot slipped and I fell.
out of position
to slide out of position or out of your hand

data.chText: 他的帽子滑下来遮住了一只眼睛。
data.enText: His hat had slipped over one eye.
The fish slipped out of my hand.

data.chText: 他一把没抓牢，让那孩子跑掉了。
data.enText: The child slipped from his grasp and ran off.

data.chText: 她小心翼翼，不让自己失控。
data.enText: She was careful not to let her control slip.
go/put quickly
to go somewhere quickly and quietly, especially without being noticed

data.chText: 她趁别人还没醒，溜出了房子。
data.enText: She slipped out of the house before the others were awake.
The ship slipped into the harbour at night.
She knew that time was slipping away.

data.chText: 迅速放置；悄悄塞；偷偷放
data.enText: to put sth somewhere quickly, quietly or secretly

data.chText: 安娜悄悄把手伸过去，让他握住。
data.enText: Anna slipped her hand into his.

data.chText: 我设法在讲话中穿插了几个笑话。
data.enText: I managed to slip a few jokes into my speech.

data.chText: 我设法穿插了几个笑话。
data.enText: I managed to slip in a few jokes.

data.chText: 他们悄悄塞给卫兵一些钱。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: They'd slipped the guards some money.

data.chText: 他们悄悄塞给卫兵一些钱。
data.enText: They'd slipped some money to the guards.
become worse
to fall to a lower level; to become worse

data.chText: 近来他已不如过去那样受欢迎。
data.enText: His popularity has slipped recently.

data.chText: 她已经赢了我三回了——我一定是退步了！
data.enText: That's three times she's beaten me─I must be slipping !
into difficult situation

data.chText: 陷入，进入（困难或不愉快的处境）
data.enText: to pass into a particular state or situation, especially a difficult or unpleasant one
He began to slip into debt.
The patient had slipped into a coma.

data.chText: 我们好像已经赶不上日程安排了。
data.enText: We seem to have slipped behind schedule.
clothes on/off
to put clothes on or to take them off quickly and easily

data.chText: 麻利地穿上 / 脱掉连衣裙
data.enText: to slip into/out of a dress
to slip your shoes on/off

data.chText: 他将一件外衣披在长袖套衫上。
data.enText: He slipped a coat over his sweatshirt.
get free
to get free; to make sth/sb/yourself free from sth

data.chText: 那艘船在夜间漂离了停泊处。
data.enText: The ship had slipped its moorings in the night.
The animal had slipped free and escaped.
let slip sth
to give sb information that is supposed to be secret

data.chText: 我一不小心说出了他花1 000英镑买走我那辆车的事。
data.enText: I happened to let it slip that he had given me £1 000 for the car.

data.chText: 她尽量不把她所知道的事泄露出去。
data.enText: She tried not to let slip what she knew.
let sth slip (through your fingers)
to miss or fail to use an opportunity

data.chText: 这个出国工作的机会你可不要错过。
data.enText: Don't let the chance to work abroad slip through your fingers.
slip your mind
if sth slips your mind , you forget it or forget to do it
slip one over on sb
to trick sb
slip through the net
when sb/sth slips through the net , an organization or a system fails to find them and deal with them

data.chText: 我们试图同所有的校友取得联系，但有一两个未能找到。
data.enText: We tried to contact all former students, but one or two slipped through the net.
(slip/be thrown) out of gear
(to become) out of control

data.chText: 她什么都没说，免得按捺不住情绪。
data.enText: She said nothing in case her temper slipped out of gear.
roll/slip/trip off the tongue
to be easy to say or pronounce

data.chText: 这个名字叫起来拗口，是不是？
data.enText: It's not a name that exactly trips off the tongue, is it?
slip away
to stop existing; to disappear or die
Their support gradually slipped away.
slip out
when sth slips out , you say it without really intending to

data.chText: 抱歉，我说了这样的话，这不过是无意中说出口的。
data.enText: I'm sorry I said that. It just slipped out.
slip up
to make a careless mistake
We can't afford to slip up.
small mistake
a small mistake, usually made by being careless or not paying attention

data.chText: 他一字不差地背诵了全诗。
data.enText: He recited the whole poem without making a single slip.
piece of paper
a small piece of paper, especially one for writing on or with sth printed on it

data.chText: 我把它记在一张纸条上。
data.enText: I wrote it down on a slip of paper.
a betting slip
act of slipping
an act of slipping
One slip and you could fall to your death.
clothing
a piece of women's underwear like a thin dress or skirt, worn under a dress
in cricket

data.chText: （击球员后侧的）守场员；守场员所站的位置
data.enText: a player who stands behind and to one side of the batsman and tries to catch the ball; the position on the field where this player stands
give sb the slip

data.chText: 摆脱某人的追踪；甩掉跟踪者
data.enText: to escape or get away from sb who is following or chasing you
a slip of a boy, girl, etc.

data.chText: 小男孩（或女孩等）；瘦男孩（或女孩等）
data.enText: a small or thin, usually young, person
a slip of the pen/tongue
a small mistake in sth that you write or say

data.chText: 我刚才是不是叫你理查德了？对不起，罗伯特，我是一时口误。
data.enText: Did I call you Richard? Sorry, Robert, just a slip of the tongue.
there's many a slip 'twixt cup and lip

data.chText: 到嘴的鸭子也会飞走（指没有十拿九稳的事）
data.enText: nothing is completely certain until it really happens because things can easily go wrong

data.text: mistake ♦ error ♦ inaccuracy ♦ slip ♦ howler ♦ misprint ♦ typo

data.chText: 以上各词均指用词、数字、事实等的错误、口误、笔误。
data.enText: These are all words for a word, figure or fact that is not said, written down or typed correctly.
mistake

data.chText: 指用词或数字上的错误、口误、笔误：
data.enText: a word or figure that is not said or written down correctly

data.chText: 这是学英语的人常犯的错误。
data.enText: It's a common mistake among learners of English.
spelling mistakes
error

data.chText: 指用词、数字等的错误、口误、笔误：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) a word, figure, etc. that is not said or written down correctly
There are too many errors in your work.
Error is a more formal way of saying mistake .
inaccuracy
( rather formal ) a piece of information that is not exactly correct

data.chText: 这篇文章里不准确的地方比比皆是。
data.enText: The article is full of inaccuracies.
slip

data.chText: 指常因粗心或未予以重视造成的差错、疏漏、纰漏
data.enText: a small mistake, usually made by being careless or not paying attention
howler

data.chText: 尤指言谈或行文中的愚蠢错误：
data.enText: ( informal , especially BrE ) a stupid mistake, especially in what sb says or writes
The report is full of howlers.

data.chText: * howler通常指令人难堪的错误，表明犯错误者不知道应该知道的东西。
data.enText: A howler is usually an embarrassing mistake which shows that the person who made it does not know sth that they really should know.
misprint
a small mistake in a printed text
typo

data.chText: 指打字或排印文稿的小错误
data.enText: ( informal ) a small mistake in a typed or printed text

data.chText: * typo多为校对人员校勘书籍、杂志等印刷错误时使用。
data.enText: Typo is mostly used by people whose work involves checking printed material before it is made into a book, magazine, etc.
a(n) mistake/error/inaccuracy/slip/howler/misprint/typo in sth
a common mistake/error/typo
a spelling/grammatical mistake/error
to make a(n) mistake/error/slip/howler/typo
to contain/be full of mistakes/errors/inaccuracies/howlers/misprints/typos
to correct the mistakes/errors/inaccuracies/misprints/typos

word_means: (= Serial Line Internet [Interface]Protocol ) 串线网际协议

means: (= Serial Line Internet [Interface]Protocol ) 串线网际协议

data.enText: let slip sth
to give sb information that is supposed to be secret

data.chText: 我一不小心说出了他花1 000英镑买走我那辆车的事。
data.enText: I happened to let it slip that he had given me £1 000 for the car.

data.chText: 她尽量不把她所知道的事泄露出去。
data.enText: She tried not to let slip what she knew.

to miss or fail to use an opportunity

data.chText: 这个出国工作的机会你可不要错过。
data.enText: Don't let the chance to work abroad slip through your fingers.
slip your mind
if sth slips your mind , you forget it or forget to do it
slip one over on sb
to trick sb
slip through the net
when sb/sth slips through the net , an organization or a system fails to find them and deal with them

data.chText: 我们试图同所有的校友取得联系，但有一两个未能找到。
data.enText: We tried to contact all former students, but one or two slipped through the net.
(slip/be thrown) out of gear

data.chText: 她什么都没说，免得按捺不住情绪。
data.enText: She said nothing in case her temper slipped out of gear.

to be easy to say or pronounce

data.chText: 这个名字叫起来拗口，是不是？
data.enText: It's not a name that exactly trips off the tongue, is it?
give sb the slip

data.chText: 摆脱某人的追踪；甩掉跟踪者
data.enText: to escape or get away from sb who is following or chasing you
a slip of a boy, girl, etc.

data.chText: 小男孩（或女孩等）；瘦男孩（或女孩等）
data.enText: a small or thin, usually young, person
a slip of the pen/tongue
a small mistake in sth that you write or say

data.chText: 我刚才是不是叫你理查德了？对不起，罗伯特，我是一时口误。
data.enText: Did I call you Richard? Sorry, Robert, just a slip of the tongue.
there's many a slip 'twixt cup and lip

data.chText: 到嘴的鸭子也会飞走（指没有十拿九稳的事）
data.enText: nothing is completely certain until it really happens because things can easily go wrong
slip away
to stop existing; to disappear or die
Their support gradually slipped away.
slip out
when sth slips out , you say it without really intending to

data.chText: 抱歉，我说了这样的话，这不过是无意中说出口的。
data.enText: I'm sorry I said that. It just slipped out.
slip up
to make a careless mistake
We can't afford to slip up.

tr: the act of avoiding capture (especially by cunning)
a minor inadvertent mistake usually observed in speech or writing or in small accidents or memory lapses etc.
a socially awkward or tactless act
a flight maneuver
aircraft slides sideways in the air
an unexpected slide
bed linen consisting of a cover for a pillow
example: the burglar carried his loot in a pillowcase

tr: a woman's sleeveless undergarment
a small sheet of paper
artifact consisting of a narrow flat piece of material
a slippery smoothness
example: he could feel the slickness of the tiller

tr: an accidental misstep threatening (or causing) a fall
example: he blamed his slip on the ice
the jolt caused many slips and a few spills

tr: a place where a craft can be made fast
a young and slender person
example: he's a mere slip of a lad

tr: a part (sometimes a root or leaf or bud) removed from a plant to propagate a new plant through rooting or grafting
potter's clay that is thinned and used for coating or decorating ceramics
insert inconspicuously or quickly or quietly
example: He slipped some money into the waiter's hand

tr: get worse
move out of position
example: the artificial hip joint luxated and had to be put back surgically

tr: pass out of one's memory
to make a mistake or be incorrect
move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner
example: the wheels skidded against the sidewalk

tr: move stealthily
example: The ship slipped away in the darkness

tr: move smoothly and easily
example: water slipped from the polished marble

tr: cause to move with a smooth or sliding motion
example: he slipped the bolt into place

tr: move easily
pass on stealthily
example: He slipped me the key when nobody was looking

value.def: If you slip, you accidentally slide and lose your balance.

example.ex: He had slipped on an icy pavement...
example.tran: 他在一条结了冰的人行道上滑了一跤。

example.ex: Be careful not to slip.
example.tran: 小心，别滑倒了。

value.def: If something slips, it slides out of place or out of your hand.

example.ex: His glasses had slipped...
example.tran: 他的眼镜滑掉了。

example.ex: The hammer slipped out of her grasp.
example.tran: 锤子从她的手中滑落。

value.def: If you slip somewhere, you go there quickly and quietly.

example.ex: Amy slipped downstairs and out of the house...
example.tran: 埃米偷偷下楼溜出了房子。

example.ex: She slipped into the driving seat and closed the door.
example.tran: 她溜进了驾驶座，关上了门。

value.tran: 迅速而悄无声息地走(到某处);溜(到某处)

value.def: If you slip something somewhere, you put it there quickly in a way that does not attract attention.

example.ex: I slipped a note under Louise's door...
example.tran: 我偷偷在路易斯的房门下面塞了一张便条。

example.ex: He found a coin in his pocket and slipped it into her collecting tin...
example.tran: 他摸到口袋里有一枚硬币，便匆匆丢进她的讨钱罐。

example.ex: Just slip in a piece of paper.
example.tran: 只要塞进一张纸就行。

value.tran: 迅速而不被注意地放置;偷偷塞进

value.def: If you slip something to someone, you give it to them secretly.

example.ex: Robert had slipped her a note in school...
example.tran: 罗伯特在学校里偷偷地塞给她一张纸条。

example.ex: She looked round before pulling out a package and slipping it to the man.
example.tran: 她四下里看了看，然后拿出一个包裹，偷偷地塞给了这个男人。

value.def: To slip into a particular state or situation means to pass gradually into it, in a way that is hardly noticed.

example.ex: It amazed him how easily one could slip into a routine...
example.tran: 他惊异地发现人很容易在不知不觉中因循守旧起来。

example.ex: There was a 50-50 chance that the economy could slip back into recession.
example.tran: 经济再次陷入衰退的可能性是 50%。

value.tran: 不知不觉地转入(某种状态);逐渐陷入(某种情况)

value.def: If something slips to a lower level or standard, it falls to that level or standard.

example.ex: Shares slipped to 117p...
example.tran: 股价跌至 117 便士。

example.ex: The club had slipped to the bottom of Division Four...
example.tran: 该俱乐部已经跌为丁级组的最后一名。

example.ex: In June, producer prices slipped 0.1% from May...
example.tran: 6 月的生产价格比 5 月下降了 0.1%。

example.ex: Overall business activity is slipping.
example.tran: 商业活动整体趋于萧条。

example.ex: ...a slip in consumer confidence.
example.tran: 消费者信心的下降

value.def: If you slip into or out of clothes or shoes, you put them on or take them off quickly and easily.

example.ex: She slipped out of the jacket and tossed it on the couch...
example.tran: 她麻利地脱下夹克，扔在了沙发上。

example.ex: I slipped off my woollen gloves.
example.tran: 我迅速地脱下了毛绒手套。

value.def: A slip is a small or unimportant mistake.

example.ex: We must be well prepared, there must be no slips.
example.tran: 我们必须好好准备，不能出任何差错。

value.def: A slip of paper is a small piece of paper.

example.ex: ...little slips of paper he had torn from a notebook...
example.tran: 他从笔记本上撕下来的一张张小纸片

example.ex: I put her name on the slip.
example.tran: 我在纸条上记下了她的名字。

example.ex: ...credit card slips.
example.tran: 信用卡刷卡单

value.def: A slip is a thin piece of clothing that a woman wears under her dress or skirt.
If you refer to someone as a slip of a girl or a slip of a boy, you mean they are small, thin, and young.

example.ex: He's a mere slip of a lad compared to his brother...
example.tran: 跟他哥哥一比，他不过是个小毛孩。

example.ex: She was just a slip of a thing.
example.tran: 她才是个小丫头。

value.def: If you give someone the slip, you escape from them when they are following you or watching you.

example.ex: He gave reporters the slip by leaving at midnight.
example.tran: 他在午夜时分离开，避开了记者的追踪。

value.def: If you let slip information, you accidentally tell it to someone, when you wanted to keep it secret.

example.ex: I bet he let slip that I'd gone to America.
example.tran: 我可以打赌，是他走漏了我去了美国的消息。

value.def: If something slips your mind, you forget about it.

example.ex: The reason for my visit had obviously slipped his mind.
example.tran: 他显然已经忘掉了我的来意。

trans: 滑移线；滑移线法；回头缆；滑线；滑移線
滑移速度；滑流速度；滑脱速度；滑动速度；相对速度
滑脱；无意中说出；悄悄溜走；滑出来；溜出
滑移率；转差率；滑率；滑移比；滑差比
流逝；不计穷途去掠过；飞掠而过
滑模；提升模板；滑动模板
